services.libreswan.connections.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with "\n"s

services.libreswan.enable.description: Whether to enable libreswan ipsec service.

services.lidarr.openFirewall.description: Open ports in the firewall for Lidarr

services.lidarr.user.description: User account under which Lidarr runs.

services.lighttpd.cgit.configText.description:
Verbatim contents of the cgit runtime configuration file. Documentation
(with cgitrc example file) is available in "man cgitrc". Or online:
http://git.zx2c4.com/cgit/tree/cgitrc.5.txt

services.lighttpd.cgit.enable.description:
If true, enable cgit (fast web interface for git repositories) as a
sub-service in lighttpd.

services.lighttpd.cgit.subdir.description:
The subdirectory in which to serve cgit. The web application will be
accessible at http://yourserver/${subdir}

services.lighttpd.collectd.collectionCgi.description:
Path to collection.cgi script from (collectd sources)/contrib/collection.cgi
This option allows to use a customized version

services.lighttpd.collectd.enable.description: Whether to enable collectd subservice accessible at http://yourserver/collectd.

services.lighttpd.configText.description:
Overridable config file contents to use for lighttpd. By default, use
the contents automatically generated by NixOS.

services.lighttpd.document-root.description: Document-root of the web server. Must be readable by the "lighttpd" user.

services.lighttpd.enableModules.description:
List of lighttpd modules to enable. Sub-services take care of
enabling modules as needed, so this option is mainly for when you
want to add custom stuff to
<option>services.lighttpd.extraConfig</option> that depends on a
certain module.

services.lighttpd.enableUpstreamMimeType.description:
Whether to include the list of mime types bundled with lighttpd
(upstream). If you disable this, no mime types will be added by
NixOS and you will have to add your own mime types in
<option>services.lighttpd.extraConfig</option>.

services.lighttpd.extraConfig.description:
These configuration lines will be appended to the generated lighttpd
config file. Note that this mechanism does not work when the manual
<option>configText</option> option is used.

services.lighttpd.gitweb.enable.description: If true, enable gitweb in lighttpd. Access it at http://yourserver/gitweb

services.lighttpd.mod_status.description:
Show server status overview at /server-status, statistics at
/server-statistics and list of loaded modules at /server-config.

services.lighttpd.mod_userdir.description:
If true, requests in the form /~user/page.html are rewritten to take
the file public_html/page.html from the home directory of the user.

services.lighttpd.port.description: TCP port number for lighttpd to bind to.

services.limesurvey.config.description:
LimeSurvey configuration. Refer to
<link xlink:href="https://manual.limesurvey.org/Optional_settings"/>
for details on supported values.
services.limesurvey.config.type: limesurvey config type (str, int, bool or attribute set thereof)

services.limesurvey.database.createLocal.description:
Create the database and database user locally.
This currently only applies if database type "mysql" is selected.

services.limesurvey.database.passwordFil.description:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<option>database.user</option>.

services.limesurvey.database.socket.description: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

services.limesurvey.enable.description: Whether to enable Limesurvey web application..

services.limesurvey.poolConfig.description:
Options for the LimeSurvey PHP pool. See the documentation on <literal>php-fpm.conf</literal>
for details on configuration directives.
services.limesurvey.poolConfig.type: attribute set of string or signed integer or booleans

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.description:
Apache configuration can be done by adapting <literal>services.httpd.virtualHosts.<name></literal>.
See <xref linkend="opt-services.httpd.virtualHosts"/> for further information.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.adminAdd.description: E-mail address of the server administrator.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.document.description:
The path of Apache's document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraCon.description:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.extraSub.description: Extra subservices to enable in the webserver.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.globalRe.description:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen.description: List of { /* ip: "*"; */ port = 80;} to listen on

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.listen.*.description: Ip to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for ipv4 only, * for all.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.logForma.description: Log format for Apache's log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.robotsEn.description:
Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <link
xlink:href='http://www.robotstxt.org/'/> for details.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.servedDi.description: This option provides a simple way to serve static directories.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.servedFi.description: This option provides a simple way to serve individual, static files.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.serverAl.description: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

services.limesurvey.virtualHost.sslServe.description: Path to server SSL chain file.
Path to server SSL certificate key.

services.liquidsoap.streams.description:
Set of Liquidsoap streams to start,
one systemd service per stream.
services.liquidsoap.streams.type: attribute set of path or strings

services.lirc.configs.description: Configurations for lircd to load, see man:lircd.conf(5) for details (<filename>lircd.conf</filename>)

services.lirc.options.description: LIRC default options descriped in man:lircd(8) (<filename>lirc_options.conf</filename>)

services.lldpd.enable.description: Whether to enable Link Layer Discovery Protocol Daemon.

services.lldpd.extraArgs.description: List of command line parameters for lldpd

services.localtime.enable.description:
Enable <literal>localtime</literal>, simple daemon for keeping the system
timezone up-to-date based on the current location. It uses geoclue2 to
determine the current location and systemd-timedated to actually set
the timezone.

services.locate.enable.description:
If enabled, NixOS will periodically update the database of
files used by the <command>locate</command> command.

services.locate.interval.description:
Update the locate database at this interval. Updates by
default at 2:15 AM every day.

The format is described in
<citerefentry><refentrytitle>systemd.time</refentrytitle>
<manvolnum>7</manvolnum></citerefentry>.

services.locate.localuser.description:
The user to search non-network directories as, using
<command>su</command>.

services.locate.pruneBindMounts.description: Whether not to index bind mounts

services.locate.pruneFS.description: Which filesystem types to exclude from indexing

services.locate.pruneNames.description: Directory components which should exclude paths containing them from indexing

services.locate.prunePaths.description: Which paths to exclude from indexing

services.logcheck.config.description: Config options that you would like in logcheck.conf.

services.logcheck.extraGroups.description:
Extra groups for the logcheck user, for example to be able to use sendmail,
or to access certain log files.

services.logcheck.ignore.description: This option defines extra ignore rules.

services.logcheck.ignore.<name>.regex.description: Regex specifying which log lines to ignore.

services.logcheck.ignoreCron.description: This option defines extra ignore rules for cronjobs.

services.logcheck.ignoreCron.<name>.cmdl.description: Command line for the cron job. Will be turned into a regex for the logcheck ignore rule.

services.logcheck.ignoreCron.<name>.time.description:
"min hr dom mon dow" crontab time args, to auto-create a cronjob too.
Leave at null to not do this and just add a logcheck ignore rule.

services.logcheck.level.description: Set the logcheck level. Either "workstation", "server", or "paranoid".

services.logcheck.mailTo.description: Email address to send reports to.

services.logcheck.timeOfDay.description:
Time of day to run logcheck. A logcheck will be scheduled at xx:02 each day.
Leave default (*) to run every hour. Of course when nothing special was logged,
logcheck will be silent.

services.logind.extraConfig.description:
Extra config options for systemd-logind. See
<link xlink:href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/logind.conf.html">
logind.conf(5)</link> for available options.

services.logind.killUserProcesses.description:
Specifies whether the processes of a user should be killed
when the user logs out.  If true, the scope unit corresponding
to the session and all processes inside that scope will be
terminated.  If false, the scope is "abandoned" (see
<link xlink:href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd.scope.html#">
systemd.scope(5)</link>), and processes are not killed.
</para>

<para>
See <link xlink:href="https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/logind.conf.html#KillUserProcesses=">logind.conf(5)</link>
for more details.

services.logind.lidSwitch.description: Specifies what to be done when the laptop lid is closed.

services.logind.lidSwitchDocked.description:
Specifies what to be done when the laptop lid is closed
and another screen is added.

services.logind.lidSwitchExternalPower.description:
Specifies what to do when the laptop lid is closed and the system is
on external power. By default use the same action as specified in
services.logind.lidSwitch.

services.logkeys.device.description: Use the given device as keyboard input event device instead of /dev/input/eventX default.

services.logmein-hamachi.enable.description:
Whether to enable LogMeIn Hamachi, a proprietary
(closed source) commercial VPN software.

services.logrotate.config.description: The contents of the logrotate config file

services.logstash.dataDir.description:
A path to directory writable by logstash that it uses to store data.
Plugins will also have access to this path.

services.logstash.extraSettings.description: Extra Logstash settings in YAML format.

services.logstash.filterWorkers.description: The quantity of filter workers to run.

services.logstash.listenAddress.description: Address on which to start webserver.

services.logstash.outputConfig.example:
redis { host => ["localhost"] data_type => "list" key => "logstash" codec => json }
elasticsearch { }

services.logstash.plugins.description: The paths to find other logstash plugins in.

services.logstash.port.description: Port on which to start webserver.

services.loki.configFile.description: Specify a configuration file that Loki should use.

services.loki.configuration.description: Specify the configuration for Loki in Nix.

services.loki.extraFlags.description:
Specify a list of additional command line flags,
which get escaped and are then passed to Loki.

services.loki.group.description: Group under which the Loki service runs.

services.loki.user.description: User under which the Loki service runs.

services.longview.apacheStatusUrl.description:
The Apache status page URL. If provided, Longview will
gather statistics from this location. This requires Apache
mod_status to be loaded and enabled.

services.longview.apiKey.description:
Longview API key. To get this, look in Longview settings which
are found at https://manager.linode.com/longview/.

Warning: this secret is stored in the world-readable Nix store!
Use <option>apiKeyFile</option> instead.

services.longview.apiKeyFile.description:
A file containing the Longview API key.
To get this, look in Longview settings which
are found at https://manager.linode.com/longview/.

<option>apiKeyFile</option> takes precedence over <option>apiKey</option>.

services.longview.enable.description: If enabled, system metrics will be sent to Linode LongView.

services.longview.mysqlPassword.description:
The password corresponding to <option>mysqlUser</option>.
Warning: this is stored in cleartext in the Nix store!
Use <option>mysqlPasswordFile</option> instead.

services.longview.mysqlPasswordFile.description: A file containing the password corresponding to <option>mysqlUser</option>.

services.longview.mysqlUser.description:
The user for connecting to the MySQL database. If provided,
Longview will connect to MySQL and collect statistics about
queries, etc. This user does not need to have been granted
any extra privileges.

services.longview.nginxStatusUrl.description:
The Nginx status page URL. Longview will gather statistics
from this URL. This requires the Nginx stub_status module to
be enabled and configured at the given location.

services.lorri.enable.description:
Enables the daemon for `lorri`, a nix-shell replacement for project
development. The socket-activated daemon starts on the first request
issued by the `lorri` command.

services.lshd.enable.description:
Whether to enable the GNU lshd SSH2 daemon, which allows
secure remote login.

services.lshd.hostKey.description:
Path to the server's private key.  Note that this key must
have been created, e.g., using "lsh-keygen --server |
lsh-writekey --server", so that you can run lshd.

services.lshd.interfaces.description:
List of network interfaces where listening for connections.
When providing the empty list, `[]', lshd listens on all
network interfaces.

services.lshd.loginShell.description:
If non-null, override the default login shell with the
specified value.

services.lshd.portNumber.description: The port on which to listen for connections.

services.lshd.publicKeyAuthentication.description: Whether to enable public key authentication.

services.lshd.rootLogin.description: Whether to enable remote root login.

services.lshd.srpKeyExchange.description: Whether to enable SRP key exchange and user authentication.

services.lshd.subsystems.description:
List of subsystem-path pairs, where the head of the pair
denotes the subsystem name, and the tail denotes the path to
an executable implementing it.

services.magnetico.crawler.address.description: Address to be used for indexing DHT nodes.

services.magnetico.crawler.extraOptions.description: Extra command line arguments to pass to magneticod.

services.magnetico.crawler.maxNeighbors.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous neighbors of an indexer.
Be careful changing this number: high values can very
easily cause your network to be congested or even crash
your router.

services.magnetico.crawler.port.description:
Port to be used for indexing DHT nodes.
This port should be added to
<option>networking.firewall.allowedTCPPorts</option>.
services.magnetico.crawler.port.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.magnetico.enable.description: Whether to enable Magnetico, Bittorrent DHT crawler.

services.magnetico.web.address.description: Address the web interface will listen to.

services.magnetico.web.credentials.description:
The credentials to access the web interface, in case authentication is
enabled, in the format <literal>username:hash</literal>. If unset no
authentication will be required.

Usernames must start with a lowercase ([a-z]) ASCII character, might
contain non-consecutive underscores except at the end, and consists of
small-case a-z characters and digits 0-9.  The
<command>htpasswd</command> tool from the <package>apacheHttpd
</package> package may be used to generate the hash: <command>htpasswd
-bnBC 12 username password</command>

<warning>
<para>
  The hashes will be stored world-readable in the nix store.
  Consider using the <literal>credentialsFile</literal> option if you
  don't want this.
</para>
</warning>

services.magnetico.web.credentialsFile.description:
The path to the file holding the credentials to access the web
interface. If unset no authentication will be required.

The file must constain user names and password hashes in the format
<literal>username:hash </literal>, one for each line.  Usernames must
start with a lowecase ([a-z]) ASCII character, might contain
non-consecutive underscores except at the end, and consists of
small-case a-z characters and digits 0-9.
The <command>htpasswd</command> tool from the <package>apacheHttpd
</package> package may be used to generate the hash:
<command>htpasswd -bnBC 12 username password</command>

services.magnetico.web.extraOptions.description: Extra command line arguments to pass to magneticow.

services.magnetico.web.port.description: Port the web interface will listen to.
services.magnetico.web.port.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.mail.freepopsd.bind.description: Bind over an IPv4 address instead of any.

services.mail.freepopsd.enable.description: Enables Freepops, a POP3 webmail wrapper.

services.mail.freepopsd.logFile.description: Filename of the log file or syslog to rely on the logging daemon.

services.mail.freepopsd.port.description: Port on which the pop server will listen.

services.mail.freepopsd.suid.group.description: Group under which freepopsd will be after binding the port.

services.mail.freepopsd.suid.user.description: User name under which freepopsd will be after binding the port.

services.mailcatcher.http.ip.description: The ip address of the http server.

services.mailcatcher.http.port.description: The port address of the http server.
services.mailcatcher.http.port.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.mailcatcher.smtp.ip.description: The ip address of the smtp server.

services.mailcatcher.smtp.port.description: The port address of the smtp server.
services.mailcatcher.smtp.port.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.mailhog.user.description: User account under which mailhog runs.

services.mailman.enable.description: Enable Mailman on this host. Requires an active Postfix installation.

services.mailman.hyperkittyApiKey.description:
The shared secret used to authenticate Mailman's internal
communication with Hyperkitty. Must be set to enable support for the
Hyperkitty archiver. Note that this secret is going to be visible to
all local users in the Nix store.

services.mailman.hyperkittyBaseUrl.description:
Where can Mailman connect to Hyperkitty's internal API, preferably on
localhost?

services.mailman.siteOwner.description:
Certain messages that must be delivered to a human, but which can't
be delivered to a list owner (e.g. a bounce from a list owner), will
be sent to this address. It should point to a human.

services.mailman.webHosts.description:
The list of hostnames and/or IP addresses from which the Mailman Web
UI will accept requests. By default, "localhost" and "127.0.0.1" are
enabled. All additional names under which your web server accepts
requests for the UI must be listed here or incoming requests will be
rejected.

services.mailman.webRoot.description:
The web root for the Hyperkity + Postorius apps provided by Mailman.
This variable can be set, of course, but it mainly exists so that site
admins can refer to it in their own hand-written httpd configuration files.

services.mailpile.enable.description: Whether to enable Mailpile the mail client.

services.mailpile.hostname.description: Listen to this hostname or ip.

services.marathon.enable.description: Whether to enable the marathon mesos framework.

services.marathon.extraCmdLineOptions.description:
Extra command line options to pass to Marathon.
	See <link xlink:href="https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/command-line-flags.html"/> for all possible flags.

services.marathon.httpPort.description: Marathon listening port for HTTP connections.

services.marathon.master.description: Mesos master address. See <link xlink:href="https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/docs/"/> for details.

services.marathon.user.description:
The user that the Marathon framework will be launched as. If the user doesn't exist it will be created.
	If you want to run apps that require root access or you want to launch apps using arbitrary users, that
	is using the `--mesos_user` flag then you need to change this to `root`.

services.mathics.enable.description: Whether to enable Mathics notebook service.

services.mathics.external.description: Listen on all interfaces, rather than just localhost?

services.matomo.enable.description:
Enable Matomo web analytics with php-fpm backend.
Either the nginx option or the webServerUser option is mandatory.

services.matomo.nginx.description:
With this option, you can customize an nginx virtualHost which already has sensible defaults for Matomo.
Either this option or the webServerUser option is mandatory.
Set this to {} to just enable the virtualHost if you don't need any customization.
If enabled, then by default, the <option>serverName</option> is
<literal>${user}.${config.networking.hostName}.${config.networking.domain}</literal>,
SSL is active, and certificates are acquired via ACME.
If this is set to null (the default), no nginx virtualHost will be configured.

services.matomo.nginx.acmeFallbackHost.description:
Host which to proxy requests to if acme challenge is not found. Useful
if you want multiple hosts to be able to verify the same domain name.

services.matomo.nginx.acmeRoot.description: Directory for the acme challenge which is PUBLIC, don't put certs or keys in here

services.matomo.nginx.addSSL.description:
Whether to enable HTTPS in addition to plain HTTP. This will set defaults for
<literal>listen</literal> to listen on all interfaces on the respective default
ports (80, 443).

services.matomo.nginx.basicAuth.description:
Basic Auth protection for a vhost.

WARNING: This is implemented to store the password in plain text in the
nix store.

services.matomo.nginx.basicAuthFile.description: Basic Auth password file for a vhost.

services.matomo.nginx.enableACME.description:
Whether to ask Let's Encrypt to sign a certificate for this vhost.
Alternately, you can use an existing certificate through <option>useACMEHost</option>.

services.matomo.nginx.extraConfig.description: These lines go to the end of the vhost verbatim.

services.matomo.nginx.forceSSL.description:
Whether to add a separate nginx server block that permanently redirects (301)
all plain HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This will set defaults for
<literal>listen</literal> to listen on all interfaces on the respective default
ports (80, 443), where the non-SSL listens are used for the redirect vhosts.

services.matomo.nginx.globalRedirect.description:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given hostname.

services.matomo.nginx.http2.description:
Whether to enable HTTP 2.
Note that (as of writing) due to nginx's implementation, to disable
HTTP 2 you have to disable it on all vhosts that use a given
IP address / port.
If there is one server block configured to enable http2,then it is
enabled for all server blocks on this IP.
See https://stackoverflow.com/a/39466948/263061.

services.matomo.nginx.listen.description:
Listen addresses and ports for this virtual host.
IPv6 addresses must be enclosed in square brackets.
Note: this option overrides <literal>addSSL</literal>
and <literal>onlySSL</literal>.

services.matomo.nginx.listen.*.extraPara.description: Extra parameters of this listen directive.

services.matomo.nginx.locations.<name>.e.description: These lines go to the end of the location verbatim.

services.matomo.nginx.locations.<name>.p.description:
Order of this location block in relation to the others in the vhost.
The semantics are the same as with `lib.mkOrder`. Smaller values have
a greater priority.

Adds proxy_pass directive and sets recommended proxy headers if
recommendedProxySettings is enabled.
Whether to supporty proxying websocket connections with HTTP/1.1.

services.matomo.nginx.locations.<name>.r.description: Adds a return directive, for e.g. redirections.

services.matomo.nginx.onlySSL.description:
Whether to enable HTTPS and reject plain HTTP connections. This will set
defaults for <literal>listen</literal> to listen on all interfaces on port 443.

services.matomo.nginx.root.description: The path of the web root directory.

services.matomo.nginx.serverAliases.description: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

services.matomo.nginx.serverName.description: Name of this virtual host. Defaults to attribute name in virtualHosts.

services.matomo.nginx.sslCertificateKey.description: Path to server SSL certificate key.

services.matomo.nginx.sslTrustedCertific.description: Path to root SSL certificate for stapling and client certificates.

services.matomo.nginx.useACMEHost.description:
A host of an existing Let's Encrypt certificate to use.
This is useful if you have many subdomains and want to avoid hitting the
<link xlink:href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/rate-limits/">rate limit</link>.
Alternately, you can generate a certificate through <option>enableACME</option>.
<emphasis>Note that this option does not create any certificates, nor it does add subdomains to existing ones  you will need to create them manually using  <xref linkend="opt-security.acme.certs"/>.</emphasis>

services.matomo.package.description:
Matomo package for the service to use.
This can be used to point to newer releases from nixos-unstable,
as they don't get backported if they are not security-relevant.

services.matomo.periodicArchiveProcessin.description:
Enable periodic archive processing, which generates aggregated reports from the visits.

This means that you can safely disable browser triggers for Matomo archiving,
and safely enable to delete old visitor logs.
Before deleting visitor logs,
make sure though that you run <literal>systemctl start matomo-archive-processing.service</literal>
at least once without errors if you have already collected data before.

services.matomo.webServerUser.description:
Name of the web server user that forwards requests to <option>services.phpfpm.pools.<name>.socket</option> the fastcgi socket for Matomo if the nginx
option is not used. Either this option or the nginx option is mandatory.
If you want to use another webserver than nginx, you need to set this to that server's user
and pass fastcgi requests to `index.php`, `matomo.php` and `piwik.php` (legacy name) to this socket.

services.matrix-synapse.account_threepid.description: Delegate SMS sending to this local process (https://localhost:8090)

services.matrix-synapse.allow_guest_acce.description:
Allows users to register as guests without a password/email/etc, and
participate in rooms hosted on this server which have been made
accessible to anonymous users.

services.matrix-synapse.app_service_conf.description: A list of application service config file to use

services.matrix-synapse.bcrypt_rounds.description:
Set the number of bcrypt rounds used to generate password hash.
Larger numbers increase the work factor needed to generate the hash.

services.matrix-synapse.bind_host.description:
DEPRECATED: Use listeners instead.
Local interface to listen on.
The empty string will cause synapse to listen on all interfaces.

services.matrix-synapse.bind_port.description:
DEPRECATED: Use listeners instead.
The port to listen for HTTPS requests on.
For when matrix traffic is sent directly to synapse.

services.matrix-synapse.create_local_dat.description: Whether to create a local database automatically.

services.matrix-synapse.dataDir.description:
The directory where matrix-synapse stores its stateful data such as
certificates, media and uploads.

services.matrix-synapse.database_args.description: Arguments to pass to the engine.

services.matrix-synapse.database_type.description: The database engine name. Can be sqlite or psycopg2.

services.matrix-synapse.dynamic_thumbnai.description:
Whether to generate new thumbnails on the fly to precisely match
the resolution requested by the client. If true then whenever
a new resolution is requested by the client the server will
generate a new thumbnail. If false the server will pick a thumbnail
from a precalculated list.

services.matrix-synapse.enable_metrics.description: Enable collection and rendering of performance metrics

services.matrix-synapse.enable_registrat.description:
Enables ReCaptcha checks when registering, preventing signup
unless a captcha is answered. Requires a valid ReCaptcha
public/private key.

services.matrix-synapse.event_cache_size.description: Number of events to cache in memory.

services.matrix-synapse.expire_access_to.description: Whether to enable access token expiration.

services.matrix-synapse.extraConfigFiles.description:
Extra config files to include.

The configuration files will be included based on the command line
argument --config-path. This allows to configure secrets without
having to go through the Nix store, e.g. based on deployment keys if
NixOPS is in use.

services.matrix-synapse.federation_rc_co.description: The number of federation requests to concurrently process from a single server

services.matrix-synapse.federation_rc_re.description:
The maximum number of concurrent federation requests allowed
from a single server

services.matrix-synapse.federation_rc_sl.description:
The duration in milliseconds to delay processing events from
remote servers by if they go over the sleep limit.

The number of federation requests from a single server in a window

This should be disabled if running synapse behind a load balancer
that can do automatic compression.
List of resources to host on this listener.

services.matrix-synapse.listeners.*.tls.description: Whether to listen for HTTPS connections rather than HTTP.

services.matrix-synapse.listeners.*.x_fo.description:
Use the X-Forwarded-For (XFF) header as the client IP and not the
actual client IP.

services.matrix-synapse.logConfig.default:
version: 1

# In systemd's journal, loglevel is implicitly stored, so let's omit it
# from the message text.
formatters:
    journal_fmt:
        format: '%(name)s: [%(request)s] %(message)s'

filters:
    context:
        (): synapse.util.logcontext.LoggingContextFilter
        request: ""

handlers:
    journal:
        class: systemd.journal.JournalHandler
        formatter: journal_fmt
        filters: [context]
        SYSLOG_IDENTIFIER: synapse

root:
    level: INFO
    handlers: [journal]

disable_existing_loggers: False

services.matrix-synapse.max_image_pixels.description: Maximum number of pixels that will be thumbnailed

services.matrix-synapse.rc_message_burst.description: Number of message a client can send before being throttled

services.matrix-synapse.redaction_retent.description: How long to keep redacted events in unredacted form in the database.

services.matterbridge.configFile.description:
WARNING: THIS IS INSECURE, as your password will end up in
<filename>/nix/store</filename>, thus publicly readable. Use
<literal>services.matterbridge.configPath</literal> instead.

The matterbridge configuration file in the TOML file format.
services.matterbridge.configFile.example:
# WARNING: as this file contains credentials, do not use this option!
# It is kept only for backwards compatibility, and would cause your
# credentials to be in the nix-store, thus with the world-readable
# permission bits.
# Use services.matterbridge.configPath instead.

[irc]
    [irc.freenode]
    Server="irc.freenode.net:6667"
    Nick="matterbot"

[mattermost]
    [mattermost.work]
     # Do not prefix it with http:// or https://
     Server="yourmattermostserver.domain"
     Team="yourteam"
     Login="yourlogin"
     Password="yourpass"
     PrefixMessagesWithNick=true

[[gateway]]
name="gateway1"
enable=true
    [[gateway.inout]]
    account="irc.freenode"
    channel="#testing"

    [[gateway.inout]]
    account="mattermost.work"
    channel="off-topic"

services.mighttpd2.config.example:
# Example configuration for Mighttpd 2
Port: 80
# IP address or "*"
Host: *
Debug_Mode: Yes # Yes or No
# If available, "nobody" is much more secure for User:.
User: root
# If available, "nobody" is much more secure for Group:.
Group: root
Pid_File: /run/mighty.pid
Logging: Yes # Yes or No
Log_File: /var/log/mighty # The directory must be writable by User:
Log_File_Size: 16777216 # bytes
Log_Backup_Number: 10
Index_File: index.html
Index_Cgi: index.cgi
Status_File_Dir: /usr/local/share/mighty/status
Connection_Timeout: 30 # seconds
Fd_Cache_Duration: 10 # seconds
# Server_Name: Mighttpd/3.x.y
Tls_Port: 443
Tls_Cert_File: cert.pem # should change this with an absolute path
# should change this with comma-separated absolute paths
Tls_Chain_Files: chain.pem
# Currently, Tls_Key_File must not be encrypted.
Tls_Key_File: privkey.pem # should change this with an absolute path
Service: 0 # 0 is HTTP only, 1 is HTTPS only, 2 is both

services.mighttpd2.cores.description:
How many cores to use.
If null it will be determined automatically

services.mighttpd2.enable.description: Whether to enable Mighttpd2 web server.

services.mighttpd2.routing.example:
# Example routing for Mighttpd 2

# Domain lists
[localhost www.example.com]

# Entries are looked up in the specified order
# All paths must end with "/"

# A path to CGI scripts should be specified with "=>"
/~alice/cgi-bin/ => /home/alice/public_html/cgi-bin/

# A path to static files should be specified with "->"
/~alice/         -> /home/alice/public_html/
/cgi-bin/        => /export/cgi-bin/

# Reverse proxy rules should be specified with ">>"
# /path >> host:port/path2
# Either "host" or ":port" can be committed, but not both.
/app/cal/        >> example.net/calendar/
# Yesod app in the same server
/app/wiki/       >> 127.0.0.1:3000/

/                -> /export/www/

services.minecraft-server.dataDir.description: Directory to store Minecraft database and other state/data files.

services.minecraft-server.eula.description:

<literal>true</literal> to run Minecraft server.

services.minecraft-server.jvmOpts.description: JVM options for the Minecraft server.

services.minecraft-server.openFirewall.description: Whether to open ports in the firewall for the server.

services.minecraft-server.serverProperti.description:

<link xlink:href="https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Server.properties#Java_Edition_3"/>
for documentation on these values.
services.minecraft-server.serverProperti.type: attribute set of boolean or signed integer or strings

services.minecraft-server.whitelist.description:
Whitelisted players, only has an effect when
<option>services.minecraft-server.declarative</option> is
<literal>true</literal> and the whitelist is enabled
via <option>services.minecraft-server.serverProperties</option> by

services.minetest-server.configPath.description:
Path to the config to use.

If set to null, the config of the running user will be used:
`~/.minetest/minetest.conf`.

services.minetest-server.enable.description: If enabled, starts a Minetest Server.

services.minetest-server.gameId.description:
Id of the game to use. To list available games run 
`minetestserver --gameid list`.

If only one game exists, this option can be null.

services.minetest-server.logPath.description:
Path to logfile for logging. 

If set to null, logging will be output to stdout which means
all output will be catched by systemd.

services.minetest-server.port.description:
Port number to bind to.

If set to null, the default 30000 will be used.

services.minetest-server.world.description:

`minetestserver --world list`.

services.mingetty.autologinUser.description:
Username of the account that will be automatically logged in at the console.
If unspecified, a login prompt is shown as usual.

services.mingetty.greetingLine.description:
Welcome line printed by mingetty.
The default shows current NixOS version label, machine type and tty.

services.mingetty.helpLine.description:
Help line printed by mingetty below the welcome line.
Used by the installation CD to give some hints on
how to proceed.

services.mingetty.serialSpeed.description:
Bitrates to allow for agetty's listening on serial ports. Listing more
bitrates gives more interoperability but at the cost of long delays
for getting a sync on the line.

services.minidlna.announceInterval.description:
The interval between announces (in seconds).

By default miniDLNA will announce its presence on the network
approximately every 15 minutes.

Many people prefer shorter announce intervals (e.g. 60 seconds)
on their home networks, especially when DLNA clients are
started on demand.

services.minidlna.config.description: The contents of MiniDLNA's configuration file.

services.minidlna.enable.description:
Whether to enable MiniDLNA, a simple DLNA server.  It serves
media files such as video and music to DLNA client devices
such as televisions and media players.

services.minidlna.loglevel.description:
Defines the type of messages that should be logged, and down to
which level of importance they should be considered.

The possible types are artwork, database, general, http,
inotify, metadata, scanner, ssdp and tivo.

The levels are off, fatal, error, warn, info and
debug, listed here in order of decreasing importance.  off
turns off logging messages entirely, fatal logs the most
critical messages only, and so on down to debug that logs every
single messages.

The types are comma-separated, followed by an equal sign (=),
followed by a level that applies to the preceding types. This can
be repeated, separating each of these constructs with a comma.

Defaults to general,artwork,database,inotify,scanner,metadata,
http,ssdp,tivo=warn which logs every type of message at the
warn level.

services.minidlna.mediaDirs.description:
Directories to be scanned for media files.  The prefixes
<literal>A,</literal>, <literal>V,</literal> and
<literal>P,</literal> restrict a directory to audio, video
or image files.  The directories must be accessible to the
<literal>minidlna</literal> user account.

services.miniflux.adminCredentialsFile.description:

List of peer IP addresses to connect to *only*.
If given the other peer options will be ignored.

services.monero.extraConfig.description: Extra lines to be added verbatim to monerod configuration.

services.monero.extraNodes.description: List of additional peer IP addresses to add to the local list.

services.monero.limits.download.description:
Limit of the download rate in kB/s.
Set to <literal>-1</literal> to leave unlimited.

services.monero.limits.syncSize.description:
Maximum number of blocks to sync at once.
Set to <literal>0</literal> for adaptive.

services.monero.limits.threads.description:
Maximum number of threads used for a parallel job.
Set to <literal>0</literal> to leave unlimited.

services.monero.limits.upload.description:
Limit of the upload rate in kB/s.
Set to <literal>-1</literal> to leave unlimited.

services.monero.mining.address.description: Monero address where to send mining rewards.

services.monero.mining.threads.description:
Number of threads used for mining.
Set to <literal>0</literal> to use all available.

services.monero.priorityNodes.description:
List of peer IP addresses to connect to and
attempt to keep the connection open.

services.monero.rpc.address.description: IP address the RPC server will bind to.

services.monero.rpc.port.description: Port the RPC server will bind to.

services.monero.rpc.restricted.description: Whether to restrict RPC to view only commands.

services.monetdb.enable.description: Whether to enable the MonetDB database server.

services.monetdb.port.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

services.monetdb.user.description: User account under which MonetDB runs.

services.mongodb.dbpath.description: Location where MongoDB stores its files

services.mongodb.enable.description: Whether to enable the MongoDB server.

services.mongodb.enableAuth.description: Enable client authentication. Creates a default superuser with username root!

services.mongodb.extraConfig.description: MongoDB extra configuration in YAML format

services.mongodb.initialRootPassword.description: Password for the root user if auth is enabled.

services.mongodb.initialScript.description: A file containing MongoDB statements to execute on first startup.

services.mongodb.replSetName.description:
If this instance is part of a replica set, set its name here.
Otherwise, leave empty to run as single node.

services.mongodb.user.description: User account under which MongoDB runs

services.moodle.database.createLocally.description: Create the database and database user locally.

services.moodle.database.passwordFile.description:
A file containing the password corresponding to
<option>database.user</option>.

services.moodle.database.socket.description: Path to the unix socket file to use for authentication.

services.moodle.enable.description: Whether to enable Moodle web application.

services.moodle.extraConfig.description:
Any additional text to be appended to the config.php
configuration file. This is a PHP script. For configuration
details, see <link xlink:href="https://docs.moodle.org/37/en/Configuration_file"/>.

services.moodle.initialPassword.description:
Specifies the initial password for the admin, i.e. the password assigned if the user does not already exist.
The password specified here is world-readable in the Nix store, so it should be changed promptly.

services.moodle.poolConfig.description:
Options for the Moodle PHP pool. See the documentation on <literal>php-fpm.conf</literal>
for details on configuration directives.
services.moodle.poolConfig.type: attribute set of string or signed integer or booleans

services.moodle.virtualHost.description:
Apache configuration can be done by adapting <option>services.httpd.virtualHosts</option>.
See <xref linkend="opt-services.httpd.virtualHosts"/> for further information.

services.moodle.virtualHost.adminAddr.description: E-mail address of the server administrator.

services.moodle.virtualHost.documentRoot.description:
The path of Apache's document root directory.  If left undefined,
an empty directory in the Nix store will be used as root.

services.moodle.virtualHost.extraConfig.description:
These lines go to httpd.conf verbatim. They will go after
directories and directory aliases defined by default.

services.moodle.virtualHost.extraSubserv.description: Extra subservices to enable in the webserver.

services.moodle.virtualHost.globalRedire.description:
If set, all requests for this host are redirected permanently to
the given URL.

services.moodle.virtualHost.listen.description: List of { /* ip: "*"; */ port = 80;} to listen on

services.moodle.virtualHost.listen.*.ip.description: Ip to listen on. 0.0.0.0 for ipv4 only, * for all.

services.moodle.virtualHost.logFormat.description: Log format for Apache's log files. Possible values are: combined, common, referer, agent.

services.moodle.virtualHost.robotsEntrie.description:
Specification of pages to be ignored by web crawlers. See <link
xlink:href='http://www.robotstxt.org/'/> for details.

services.moodle.virtualHost.servedDirs.description: This option provides a simple way to serve static directories.

services.moodle.virtualHost.servedFiles.description: This option provides a simple way to serve individual, static files.

services.moodle.virtualHost.serverAliase.description: Additional names of virtual hosts served by this virtual host configuration.

services.moodle.virtualHost.sslServerCha.description: Path to server SSL chain file.

services.moodle.virtualHost.sslServerKey.description: Path to server SSL certificate key.

services.mopidy.configuration.description: The configuration that Mopidy should use.

services.mopidy.dataDir.description: The directory where Mopidy stores its state.

services.mopidy.enable.description: Whether to enable Mopidy, a music player daemon.

services.mopidy.extensionPackages.description: Mopidy extensions that should be loaded by the service.

services.mopidy.extraConfigFiles.description:
Extra config file read by Mopidy when the service starts.
Later files in the list overrides earlier configuration.

services.morty.enable.description: Whether to enable Morty proxy server. See https://github.com/asciimoo/morty.

services.morty.key.default: No HMAC url validation. Generate with echo -n somevalue | openssl dgst -sha1 -hmac somekey
services.morty.key.description:
HMAC url validation key (hexadecimal encoded).
	Leave blank to disable. Without validation key, anyone can
	submit proxy requests. Leave blank to disable.

services.morty.listenAddress.description: The address on which the service listens

services.morty.timeout.default: A resource now gets 2 seconds to respond.

services.mosquitto.aclExtraConf.description: Extra config to prepend to the ACL file.

services.mosquitto.allowAnonymous.description: Allow clients to connect without authentication.

services.mosquitto.checkPasswords.description: Refuse connection when clients provide incorrect passwords.

services.mosquitto.enable.description: Whether to enable the MQTT Mosquitto broker.

services.mosquitto.extraConf.description: Extra config to append to `mosquitto.conf` file.

services.mosquitto.host.description: Host to listen on without SSL.

services.mosquitto.port.description: Port on which to listen without SSL.

services.mosquitto.ssl.cafile.description: Path to PEM encoded CA certificates.

services.mosquitto.ssl.certfile.description: Path to PEM encoded server certificate.

services.mosquitto.ssl.host.description: Host to listen on with SSL.

services.mosquitto.ssl.keyfile.description: Path to PEM encoded server key.

services.mosquitto.ssl.port.description: Port on which to listen with SSL.

services.mosquitto.users.description: A set of users and their passwords and ACLs.

services.mosquitto.users.<name>.acl.description: Control client access to topics on the broker.

services.mosquitto.users.<name>.hashedPa.description:
Specifies the hashed password for the MQTT User.
<option>hashedPassword</option> overrides <option>password</option>.
To generate hashed password install <literal>mosquitto</literal>
package and use <literal>mosquitto_passwd</literal>.

services.mosquitto.users.<name>.password.description: Specifies the (clear text) password for the MQTT User.

services.mpd.dataDir.description:
The directory where MPD stores its state, tag cache,
playlists etc.

services.mpd.dbFile.description:
The path to MPD's database. If set to <literal>null</literal> the
parameter is omitted from the configuration.

services.mpd.enable.description: Whether to enable MPD, the music player daemon.

services.mpd.extraConfig.description:
Extra directives added to to the end of MPD's configuration file,
mpd.conf. Basic configuration like file location and uid/gid
is added automatically to the beginning of the file. For available
options see <literal>man 5 mpd.conf</literal>'.

services.mpd.group.description: Group account under which MPD runs.

services.mpd.musicDirectory.description: The directory or NFS/SMB network share where mpd reads music from.
services.mpd.musicDirectory.type: path or string matching the pattern (http|https|nfs|smb)://.+

services.mpd.network.listenAddress.description:
The address for the daemon to listen on.
Use <literal>any</literal> to listen on all addresses.

services.mpd.network.port.description:
This setting is the TCP port that is desired for the daemon to get assigned
to.

services.mpd.playlistDirectory.description: The directory where mpd stores playlists.

services.mpd.startWhenNeeded.description:
If set, <command>mpd</command> is socket-activated; that
is, instead of having it permanently running as a daemon,
systemd will start it on the first incoming connection.

services.mpd.user.description: User account under which MPD runs.

services.mstpd.enable.description: Whether to enable the multiple spanning tree protocol daemon.

services.mtprotoproxy.adTag.description: Tag for advertising that can be obtained from @MTProxybot.

services.mtprotoproxy.port.description: TCP port to accept mtproto connections on.

services.mtprotoproxy.secureOnly.description: Don't allow users to connect in non-secure mode (without random padding).

services.mtprotoproxy.users.description: Allowed users and their secrets. A secret is a 32 characters long hex string.

services.munge.password.description: The path to a daemon's secret key.

services.munin-cron.enable.description:
Enable munin-cron. Takes care of all heavy lifting to collect data from
nodes and draws graphs to html. Runs munin-update, munin-limits,
munin-graphs and munin-html in that order.

HTML output is in <filename>/var/www/munin/</filename>, configure your
favourite webserver to serve static files.

services.munin-cron.extraCSS.description:
Custom styling for the HTML that munin-cron generates. This will be
appended to the CSS files used by munin-cron and will thus take
precedence over the builtin styles.

services.munin-cron.extraGlobalConfig.description:
<filename>munin.conf</filename> extra global configuration.
See <link xlink:href='http://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/reference/munin.conf.html' />.
Useful to setup notifications, see
<link xlink:href='http://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/tutorial/alert.html' />

services.munin-cron.hosts.description:
Definitions of hosts of nodes to collect data from. Needs at least one
host for cron to succeed. See
<link xlink:href='http://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/reference/munin.conf.html' />

services.munin-node.disabledPlugins.description:
Munin plugins to disable, even if
<literal>munin-node-configure --suggest</literal> tries to enable
them. To disable a wildcard plugin, use an actual wildcard, as in
the example.

munin_stats is disabled by default as it tries to read
<literal>/var/log/munin/munin-update.log</literal> for timing
information, and the NixOS build of Munin does not write this file.

services.munin-node.enable.description:
Enable Munin Node agent. Munin node listens on 0.0.0.0 and
by default accepts connections only from 127.0.0.1 for security reasons.

See <link xlink:href='http://guide.munin-monitoring.org/en/latest/architecture/index.html' />.

services.munin-node.extraAutoPlugins.description:
Additional Munin plugins to autoconfigure, using
<literal>munin-node-configure --suggest</literal>. These should be
the actual paths to the plugin files (or directories containing them),
not just their names.

If you want to manually enable individual plugins instead, use
<option>services.munin-node.extraPlugins</option>.

Note that only plugins that have the 'autoconfig' capability will do
anything if listed here, since plugins that cannot autoconfigure
won't be automatically enabled by
<literal>munin-node-configure</literal>.

Plugins will be copied into the Nix store, and it will attempt to
modify them to run properly by fixing hardcoded references to
<literal>/bin</literal>, <literal>/usr/bin</literal>,
<literal>/sbin</literal>, and <literal>/usr/sbin</literal>.

services.munin-node.extraPlugins.description:
Additional Munin plugins to activate. Keys are the name of the plugin
symlink, values are the path to the underlying plugin script. You
can use the same plugin script multiple times (e.g. for wildcard
plugins).

Note that these plugins do not participate in autoconfiguration. If
you want to autoconfigure additional plugins, use
<option>services.munin-node.extraAutoPlugins</option>.

Plugins enabled in this manner take precedence over autoconfigured
plugins.

Plugins will be copied into the Nix store, and it will attempt to
modify them to run properly by fixing hardcoded references to
<literal>/bin</literal>, <literal>/usr/bin</literal>,
<literal>/sbin</literal>, and <literal>/usr/sbin</literal>.

services.murmur.allowHtml.description:
Allow HTML in client messages, comments, and channel
descriptions.

services.murmur.autobanAttempts.description:
Number of attempts a client is allowed to make in
<literal>autobanTimeframe</literal> seconds, before being
banned for <literal>autobanTime</literal>.

services.murmur.autobanTime.description: The amount of time an IP ban lasts (in seconds).

services.murmur.autobanTimeframe.description:
Timeframe in which a client can connect without being banned
for repeated attempts (in seconds).

services.murmur.bandwidth.description:
Maximum bandwidth (in bits per second) that clients may send
speech at.

services.murmur.bonjour.description:
Enable Bonjour auto-discovery, which allows clients over
your LAN to automatically discover Murmur servers.

services.murmur.clientCertRequired.description: Require clients to authenticate via certificates.

services.murmur.enable.description: If enabled, start the Murmur Mumble server.

services.murmur.extraConfig.description: Extra configuration to put into murmur.ini.

services.murmur.hostName.description: Host to bind to. Defaults binding on all addresses.

services.murmur.imgMsgLength.description: Max length of image messages. Set 0 for no limit.

services.murmur.logDays.description:
How long to store RPC logs for in the database. Set 0 to
keep logs forever, or -1 to disable DB logging.

services.murmur.logFile.description: Path to the log file for Murmur daemon. Empty means log to journald.

services.murmur.password.description: Required password to join server, if specified.

services.murmur.port.description: Ports to bind to (UDP and TCP).

services.murmur.registerHostname.description:
DNS hostname where your server can be reached. This is only
needed if you want your server to be accessed by its
hostname and not IP - but the name *must* resolve on the
internet properly.

services.murmur.registerName.description:
Public server registration name, and also the name of the
Root channel. Even if you don't publicly register your
server, you probably still want to set this.

services.murmur.registerPassword.description:
Public server registry password, used authenticate your
server to the registry to prevent impersonation; required for
subsequent registry updates.

services.murmur.sendVersion.description: Send Murmur version in UDP response.

services.murmur.sslCa.description: Path to your SSL CA certificate.

services.murmur.textMsgLength.description: Max length of text messages. Set 0 for no limit.

services.murmur.users.description: Maximum number of concurrent clients allowed.

services.mwlib.nserve.address.description: Specify network interface to listen on.

services.mwlib.nserve.enable.description:
Whether to enable nserve. Nserve is a HTTP
server.  The Collection extension is talking to
that program directly.  Nserve uses at least
one qserve instance in order to distribute
and manage jobs.

services.mwlib.nslave.enable.description:
Pulls new jobs from exactly one qserve instance
and calls the zip and render programs
in order to download article collections and
convert them to different output formats. Nslave
uses a cache directory to store the generated
documents. Nslave also starts an internal http
server serving the content of the cache directory.

services.mwlib.nslave.http.description:
Internal http server serving the content of the cache directory.
You have to enable it, or use your own way for serving files
and set the http.url option accordingly.

services.mwlib.nslave.http.address.description: Specify network interface to listen on.

services.mwlib.nslave.http.port.description: Port to listen to when serving files from cache.

services.mwlib.nslave.http.url.description:
Specify URL for accessing generated files from cache.
The Collection extension of Mediawiki won't be able to
download files without it.

services.mwlib.nslave.numprocs.description: Number of parallel jobs to be executed.

services.mwlib.qserve.address.description: Specify network interface to listen on.

services.mwlib.qserve.allow.description: List of allowed client IPs. Empty means any.

services.mwlib.qserve.enable.description:
A job queue server used to distribute and manage
jobs. You should start one qserve instance
for each machine that is supposed to render pdf
files. Unless youre operating the Wikipedia
installation, one machine should suffice.

services.mxisd.enable.description: Whether to enable mxisd matrix federated identity server.

services.mxisd.extraConfig.description: Extra options merged into the mxisd configuration

services.mxisd.matrix.domain.description: the domain of the matrix homeserver

services.mxisd.server.name.description: Public hostname of mxisd, if different from the Matrix domain.

services.mysql.bind.description: Address to bind to. The default is to bind to all addresses

services.mysql.dataDir.description: Location where MySQL stores its table files

services.mysql.enable.description: Whether to enable the MySQL server.

services.mysql.ensureDatabases.description:
Ensures that the specified databases exist.
This option will never delete existing databases, especially not when the value of this
option is changed. This means that databases created once through this option or
otherwise have to be removed manually.

services.mysql.ensureUsers.description:
Ensures that the specified users exist and have at least the ensured permissions.
The MySQL users will be identified using Unix socket authentication. This authenticates the Unix user with the
same name only, and that without the need for a password.
This option will never delete existing users or remove permissions, especially not when the value of this
option is changed. This means that users created and permissions assigned once through this option or
otherwise have to be removed manually.

services.mysql.ensureUsers.*.ensurePermi.description: Permissions to ensure for the user, specified as attribute set. The attribute names specify the database and tables to grant the permissions for, separated by a dot. You may use wildcards here. The attribute values specfiy the permissions to grant. You may specify one or multiple comma-separated SQL privileges here. For more information on how to specify the target and on which privileges exist, see the GRANT syntax. The attributes are used as GRANT ${attrName} ON ${attrValue}.

services.mysql.ensureUsers.*.name.description: Name of the user to ensure.

services.mysql.extraOptions.description:
Provide extra options to the MySQL configuration file.

Please note, that these options are added to the
<literal>[mysqld]</literal> section so you don't need to explicitly
state it again.

services.mysql.initialDatabases.description:
List of database names and their initial schemas that should be used to create databases on the first startup
of MySQL. The schema attribute is optional: If not specified, an empty database is created.

services.mysql.initialDatabases.*.name.description: The name of the database to create.

services.mysql.initialDatabases.*.schema.description:
The initial schema of the database; if null (the default),
an empty database is created.

services.mysql.initialScript.description: A file containing SQL statements to be executed on the first startup. Can be used for granting certain permissions on the database

services.mysql.package.description: Which MySQL derivation to use. MariaDB packages are supported too.

services.mysql.replication.masterHost.description: Hostname of the MySQL master server

services.mysql.replication.masterPasswor.description: Password of the MySQL replication user

services.mysql.replication.masterPort.description: Port number on which the MySQL master server runs

services.mysql.replication.masterUser.description: Username of the MySQL replication user

services.mysql.replication.role.description: Role of the MySQL server instance.

services.mysql.replication.serverId.description: Id of the MySQL server instance. This number must be unique for each instance

services.mysql.replication.slaveHost.description: Hostname of the MySQL slave server

services.mysql.user.description: User account under which MySQL runs

services.mysqlBackup.calendar.description: Configured when to run the backup service systemd unit (DayOfWeek Year-Month-Day Hour:Minute:Second).

services.mysqlBackup.databases.description: List of database names to dump.

services.mysqlBackup.location.description: Location to put the gzipped MySQL database dumps.

services.mysqlBackup.singleTransaction.description: Whether to create database dump in a single transaction

services.mysqlBackup.user.description: User to be used to perform backup.

services.nagios.cgiConfigFile.description:
Derivation for the configuration file of Nagios CGI scripts
          that can be used in web servers for running the Nagios web interface.

services.nagios.enable.description:
Whether to use <link
          xlink:href='http://www.nagios.org/'>Nagios</link> to monitor
          your system or network.

services.nagios.enableWebInterface.description:
Whether to enable the Nagios web interface.  You should also
          enable Apache (<option>services.httpd.enable</option>).

services.nagios.mainConfigFile.description: Derivation for the main configuration file of Nagios.

services.nagios.objectDefs.description:
A list of Nagios object configuration files that must define
          the hosts, host groups, services and contacts for the
          network that you want Nagios to monitor.

services.nagios.plugins.description:
Packages to be added to the Nagios <envar>PATH</envar>.
          Typically used to add plugins, but can be anything.

services.nagios.urlPath.description:
The URL path under which the Nagios web interface appears.
          That is, you can access the Nagios web interface through
          <literal>http://<replaceable>server</replaceable>/<replaceable>urlPath</replaceable></literal>.

services.namecoind.enable.description: Whether to enable namecoind, Namecoin client.

services.namecoind.extraNodes.description: List of additional peer IP addresses to connect to.

services.namecoind.rpc.address.description: IP address the RPC server will bind to.

services.namecoind.rpc.allowFrom.description:
List of IP address ranges allowed to use the RPC API.
Wiledcards (*) can be user to specify a range.

services.namecoind.rpc.certificate.description: Certificate file for securing RPC connections.

services.namecoind.rpc.key.description: Key file for securing RPC connections.

services.namecoind.rpc.port.description: Port the RPC server will bind to.

services.namecoind.trustedNodes.description:
List of the only peer IP addresses to connect to. If specified
no other connection will be made.

services.namecoind.wallet.description:
Wallet file. The ownership of the file has to be
namecoin:namecoin, and the permissions must be 0640.

services.ndppd.enable.description: Whether to enable daemon that proxies NDP (Neighbor Discovery Protocol) messages between interfaces.

services.ndppd.interface.description:
Interface which is on link-level with router.
(Legacy option, use services.ndppd.proxies.<interface>.rules.<network> instead)

services.ndppd.network.description:
Network that we proxy.
(Legacy option, use services.ndppd.proxies.<interface>.rules.<network> instead)

services.ndppd.proxies.description:
This sets up a listener, that will listen for any Neighbor Solicitation
messages, and respond to them according to a set of rules.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.interface.description:
Listen for any Neighbor Solicitation messages on this interface,
and respond to them according to a set of rules.
Defaults to the name of the attrset.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.router.description: Turns on or off the router flag for Neighbor Advertisement Messages.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.rules.description:
This is a rule that the target address is to match against. If no netmask
is provided, /128 is assumed. You may have several rule sections, and the
addresses may or may not overlap.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.rules.<nam.description: Interface to use when method is iface.

static: Immediately answer any Neighbor Solicitation Messages
  (if they match the IP rule).
iface: Forward the Neighbor Solicitation Message through the specified
  interface and only respond if a matching Neighbor Advertisement
  Message is received.
auto: Same as iface, but instead of manually specifying the outgoing
  interface, check for a matching route in /proc/net/ipv6_route.

This is the target address is to match against. If no netmask
is provided, /128 is assumed. The addresses of serveral rules
may or may not overlap.
Defaults to the name of the attrset.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.timeout.description:
Controls how long to wait for a Neighbor Advertisment Message before 
invalidating the entry, in milliseconds.

services.ndppd.proxies.<name>.ttl.description:
Controls how long a valid or invalid entry remains in the cache, in 
milliseconds.

services.ndppd.routeTTL.description:
This tells 'ndppd' how often to reload the route file /proc/net/ipv6_route,
in milliseconds.

services.neo4j.allowUpgrade.description: Allow upgrade of Neo4j database files from an older version.

services.neo4j.bolt.enable.description:
Enable the BOLT connector for Neo4j. Setting this option to
<literal>false</literal> will stop Neo4j from listening for incoming
connections on the BOLT port (7687 by default).

services.neo4j.bolt.listenAddress.description:
Neo4j listen address for BOLT traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <literal><ip-address>:<port-number></literal>.

services.neo4j.bolt.sslPolicy.description:
Neo4j SSL policy for BOLT traffic.
</para>
<para>
The legacy policy is a special policy which is not defined in
the policy configuration section, but rather derives from
<option>directories.certificates</option> and
associated files (by default: <filename>neo4j.key</filename> and
<filename>neo4j.cert</filename>). Its use will be deprecated.
</para>
<para>
Note: This connector must be configured to support/require
SSL/TLS for the legacy policy to actually be utilized. See
<option>bolt.tlsLevel</option>.

services.neo4j.bolt.tlsLevel.description: SSL/TSL requirement level for BOLT traffic.

services.neo4j.constrainLoadCsv.description:
Sets the root directory for file URLs used with the Cypher
<literal>LOAD CSV</literal> clause to be that defined by
<option>directories.imports</option>. It restricts
access to only those files within that directory and its
subdirectories.
</para>
<para>
Setting this option to <literal>false</literal> introduces
possible security problems.

services.neo4j.defaultListenAddress.description:
Default network interface to listen for incoming connections. To
listen for connections on all interfaces, use "0.0.0.0".
</para>
<para>
Specifies the default IP address and address part of connector
specific <option>listenAddress</option> options. To bind specific
connectors to a specific network interfaces, specify the entire
<option>listenAddress</option> option for that connector.

services.neo4j.directories.certificates.description:
Directory for storing certificates to be used by Neo4j for
TLS connections.
</para>
<para>
When setting this directory to something other than its default,
ensure the directory's existence, and that read/write permissions are
given to the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.
</para>
<para>
Note that changing this directory from its default will prevent
the directory structure required for each SSL policy from being
automatically generated. A policy's directory structure as defined by
its <option>baseDirectory</option>,<option>revokedDir</option> and
<option>trustedDir</option> must then be setup manually. The
existence of these directories is mandatory, as well as the presence
of the certificate file and the private key. Ensure the correct
permissions are set on these directories and files.

services.neo4j.directories.data.description:
Path of the data directory. You must not configure more than one
Neo4j installation to use the same data directory.
</para>
<para>
When setting this directory to something other than its default,
ensure the directory's existence, and that read/write permissions are
given to the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.

services.neo4j.directories.home.description:
Path of the Neo4j home directory. Other default directories are
subdirectories of this path. This directory will be created if
non-existent, and its ownership will be <command>chown</command> to
the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.

services.neo4j.directories.imports.description:
The root directory for file URLs used with the Cypher
<literal>LOAD CSV</literal> clause. Only meaningful when
<option>constrainLoadCvs</option> is set to
<literal>true</literal>.
</para>
<para>
When setting this directory to something other than its default,
ensure the directory's existence, and that read permission is
given to the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.

services.neo4j.directories.plugins.description:
Path of the database plugin directory. Compiled Java JAR files that
contain database procedures will be loaded if they are placed in
this directory.
</para>
<para>
When setting this directory to something other than its default,
ensure the directory's existence, and that read permission is
given to the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.

services.neo4j.enable.description: Whether to enable Neo4j Community Edition.

services.neo4j.extraServerConfig.description:
Extra configuration for Neo4j Community server. Refer to the
<link xlink:href="https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/reference/configuration-settings/">complete reference</link>
of Neo4j configuration settings.

services.neo4j.http.enable.description:
The HTTP connector is required for Neo4j, and cannot be disabled.
Setting this option to <literal>false</literal> will force the HTTP
connector's <option>listenAddress</option> to the loopback
interface to prevent connection of remote clients. To prevent all
clients from connecting, block the HTTP port (7474 by default) by
firewall.

services.neo4j.http.listenAddress.description:
Neo4j listen address for HTTP traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <literal><ip-address>:<port-number></literal>.

services.neo4j.https.enable.description:
Enable the HTTPS connector for Neo4j. Setting this option to
<literal>false</literal> will stop Neo4j from listening for incoming
connections on the HTTPS port (7473 by default).

services.neo4j.https.listenAddress.description:
Neo4j listen address for HTTPS traffic. The listen address is
expressed in the format <literal><ip-address>:<port-number></literal>.

services.neo4j.https.sslPolicy.description:
Neo4j SSL policy for HTTPS traffic.
</para>
<para>
The legacy policy is a special policy which is not defined in the
policy configuration section, but rather derives from
<option>directories.certificates</option> and
associated files (by default: <filename>neo4j.key</filename> and
<filename>neo4j.cert</filename>). Its use will be deprecated.

services.neo4j.readOnly.description: Only allow read operations from this Neo4j instance.

services.neo4j.shell.enable.description:
Enable a remote shell server which Neo4j Shell clients can log in to.
Only applicable to <command>neo4j-shell</command>.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.description:
Defines the SSL policies for use with Neo4j connectors. Each attribute
of this set defines a policy, with the attribute name defining the name
of the policy and its namespace. Refer to the operations manual section
on Neo4j's
<link xlink:href="https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/security/ssl-framework/">SSL Framework</link>
for further details.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.allow.description:
Allows the generation of a private key and associated self-signed
certificate. Only performed when both objects cannot be found for
this policy. It is recommended to turn this off again after keys
have been generated.
</para>
<para>
The public certificate is required to be duplicated to the
directory holding trusted certificates as defined by the
<option>trustedDir</option> option.
</para>
<para>
Keys should in general be generated and distributed offline by a
trusted certificate authority and not by utilizing this mode.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.baseD.description:
The mandatory base directory for cryptographic objects of this
policy. This path is only automatically generated when this
option as well as <option>directories.certificates</option> are
left at their default. Ensure read/write permissions are given
to the Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.
</para>
<para>
It is also possible to override each individual
configuration with absolute paths. See the
<option>privateKey</option> and <option>publicCertificate</option>
policy options.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.ciphe.description:
Restrict the allowed ciphers of this policy to those defined
here. The default ciphers are those of the JVM platform.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.clien.description: The client authentication stance for this policy.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.priva.description:
The name of private PKCS #8 key file for this policy to be found
in the <option>baseDirectory</option>, or the absolute path to
the key file. It is mandatory that a key can be found or generated.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.publi.description:
The name of public X.509 certificate (chain) file in PEM format
for this policy to be found in the <option>baseDirectory</option>,
or the absolute path to the certificate file. It is mandatory
that a certificate can be found or generated.
</para>
<para>
The public certificate is required to be duplicated to the
directory holding trusted certificates as defined by the
<option>trustedDir</option> option.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.revok.description:
Path to directory of CRLs (Certificate Revocation Lists) in
PEM format. Must be an absolute path. The existence of this
directory is mandatory and will need to be created manually when:
setting this option to something other than its default; setting
either this policy's <option>baseDirectory</option> or
<option>directories.certificates</option> to something other than
their default. Ensure read/write permissions are given to the
Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.tlsVe.description:
Restrict the TLS protocol versions of this policy to those
defined here.

services.neo4j.ssl.policies.<name>.trust.description:
Makes this policy trust all remote parties. Enabling this is not
recommended and the policy's trusted directory will be ignored.
Use of this mode is discouraged. It would offer encryption but
no security.

Path to directory of X.509 certificates in PEM format for
trusted parties. Must be an absolute path. The existence of this
directory is mandatory and will need to be created manually when:
setting this option to something other than its default; setting
either this policy's <option>baseDirectory</option> or
<option>directories.certificates</option> to something other than
their default. Ensure read/write permissions are given to the
Neo4j daemon user <literal>neo4j</literal>.
</para>
<para>
The public certificate as defined by
<option>publicCertificate</option> is required to be duplicated
to this directory.

services.neo4j.udc.enable.description:
Enable the Usage Data Collector which Neo4j uses to collect usage
data. Refer to the operations manual section on the
<link xlink:href="https://neo4j.com/docs/operations-manual/current/configuration/usage-data-collector/">Usage Data Collector</link>
for more information.

services.neo4j.workerCount.description:
Number of Neo4j worker threads, where the default of
<literal>0</literal> indicates a worker count equal to the number of
available processors.

services.netatalk.enable.description: Whether to enable the Netatalk AFP fileserver.

services.netatalk.extmap.description:
File name extension mappings.
	  See <literal>man extmap.conf</literal> for more information.

services.netatalk.extraConfig.description:
Lines of configuration to add to the <literal>[Global]</literal> section.
See <literal>man apf.conf</literal> for more information.

services.netatalk.homes.basedirRegex.description: Regex which matches the parent directory of the user homes.

services.netatalk.homes.enable.description: Enable sharing of the UNIX server user home directories.

services.netatalk.homes.extraConfig.description:
Lines of configuration to add to the <literal>[Homes]</literal> section.
See <literal>man apf.conf</literal> for more information.

services.netatalk.homes.path.description: Share not the whole user home but this subdirectory path.

services.netatalk.port.description: TCP port to be used for AFP.

services.netatalk.volumes.description:
Set of AFP volumes to export.
See <literal>man apf.conf</literal> for more information.
services.netatalk.volumes.type: attribute set of attribute set of unspecifiedss

services.netdata.config.description: netdata.conf configuration as nix attributes. cannot be combined with configText.

services.netdata.configText.description: Verbatim netdata.conf, cannot be combined with config.
services.netdata.configText.example:
[global]
debug log = syslog
access log = syslog
error log = syslog

services.netdata.extraPluginPaths.description:
Extra paths to add to the netdata global "plugins directory"
option.  Useful for when you want to include your own
collection scripts.
</para><para>
Details about writing a custom netdata plugin are available at:
<link xlink:href="https://docs.netdata.cloud/collectors/plugins.d/"/>
</para><para>
Cannot be combined with configText.

services.netdata.python.extraPackages.description:
Extra python packages available at runtime
to enable additional python plugins.

services.netdata.user.description: User account under which netdata runs.

services.networking.websockify.enable.description: Whether to enable websockify to forward websocket connections to TCP connections.

services.nextcloud.autoUpdateApps.enable.description: Run regular auto update of all apps installed from the nextcloud app store.

services.nextcloud.autoUpdateApps.startA.description: When to run the update. See `systemd.services.<name>.startAt`.

services.nextcloud.caching.apcu.description: Whether to load the APCu module into PHP.

services.nextcloud.caching.memcached.description:
Whether to load the Memcached module into PHP.
You still need to enable Memcached in your config.php.
See https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/14/admin_manual/configuration_server/caching_configuration.html

services.nextcloud.caching.redis.description:
Whether to load the Redis module into PHP.
You still need to enable Redis in your config.php.
See https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/14/admin_manual/configuration_server/caching_configuration.html

services.nextcloud.config.adminpass.description:
Admin password.  Use <literal>adminpassFile</literal> to avoid this
being world-readable in the <literal>/nix/store</literal>.

services.nextcloud.config.adminpassFile.description: The full path to a file that contains the admin's password.

services.nextcloud.config.dbhost.description:
Database host.

Note: for using Unix authentication with PostgreSQL, this should be
set to <literal>/run/postgresql</literal>.

services.nextcloud.config.dbpass.description:
Database password.  Use <literal>dbpassFile</literal> to avoid this
being world-readable in the <literal>/nix/store</literal>.

services.nextcloud.config.dbpassFile.description: The full path to a file that contains the database password.

services.nextcloud.config.dbport.type: null or signed integer or string
